description: 7.92x57mm Mauser M75 ammunition with 198 gr copper head, lead core bullets.  Adopted by the German Empire in 1905, it has a lot of different variations and names, being a very popular cartridge for sport and hunting practices. This one was produced by Prvi Partizan, Serbia, in order to support the (then) newly deployed M76 Zastava.
Reloaded 7.92x57mm Mauser M75 ammunition with 168 gr copper head, steel core bullets.  This increases the penetration and slightly reduces the weight, at the cost of slightly reduced damage.
//: This should not exist in reality. There's a 'K bullet' which is a WWI 7.92x57mm Mauser with a steel core but I didn't found specs for it. This one's just a 792x57_m75 but has the copper-lead bullet replaced for copper-steel custom
Same thing, this is just a 792x57_m75 but has the copper-iron bullet replaced for copper-steel custom, and was reloaded with black powder
